reference_a:
@article{wright2017,
  title = {The effect of pathological narcissism on interpersonal and affective processes in social interactions.},
  author = {Wright, Aidan G. C. and Stepp, Stephanie D. and Scott, Lori N. and Hallquist, Michael N. and Beeney, Joseph E. and Lazarus, Sophie A. and Pilkonis, Paul A.},
  date = {2017-10},
  journaltitle = {Journal of Abnormal Psychology},
  shortjournal = {Journal of Abnormal Psychology},
  volume = {126},
  number = {7},
  pages = {898--910},
  issn = {1939-1846, 0021-843X},
  doi = {10.1037/abn0000286}
}
reference_b:
@article{wendt2020,
  title = {Indicators of affect dynamics: {{Structure}}, reliability, and personality correlates},
  shorttitle = {Indicators of affect dynamics},
  author = {Wendt, Leon P. and Wright, Aidan G.C. and Pilkonis, Paul A. and Woods, William C. and Denissen, Jaap J.A. and Kühnel, Anja and Zimmermann, Johannes},
  date = {2020},
  journaltitle = {European Journal of Personality},
  volume = {34},
  number = {6},
  pages = {1060--1072},
  issn = {1099-0984},
  doi = {10.1002/per.2277}
}
topics: affect, interpersonal disorders, personality pathology, emotions, social interactions
participants:
outpatients screened for personality
pathology and their romantic
partners
additional_comments: data from original study shared in more detail in Wendt et al. (2020); number of time points based on max. rows in data; variable coding partially unclear

features.name: pt_num
features.coding: slightly different than participant ID

features.name: counter
features.coding: Consecutive counter for prompt number

features.name: timestamp
features.coding: Timestamp used for ordering consecutive prompts, no raw time

features.name: date
features.coding: unclear date type, but used for consecutive ordering of prompts

features.name: dyad
features.coding: unclear, likely dyad ID

features.name: afraid
features.coding:
Rating of momentary emotions: Afraid
1 = very slightly or not at all
5 = extremely
Taken from PANAS-X
features.construct: fear, negative affect, affect, neuroticism, big five
